website_summaries.verdict: One of the world's most popular children's laptops is still going strong with new and improved up-to-date features.
pros: All the features a child could wish for in a first laptop, presented in any easy-to-use format
Four fun learning modes, including spelling, messaging, educational games, and music
A fun early introduction to basic computer skills
cons: Even at its lowest volume setting, it's a bit too loud for some

customer_reviews.title: So happy we purchased this.
customer_reviews.text: Our two year old son loves this "computer." It has really helped his speech immensely. Since this arrived he can identify several letters and their sounds. It's perfect for independent play time or when Mommy and Daddy are working on their computers as well (we work from home).
customer_reviews.author: Katie S.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. My son will miss the songs and games
customer_reviews.text: After having this for just over three months, most of the keys and the paw pad don't work. I checked the warranty, and of course it was a limited 3 month one. Very disappointed. My son will miss the songs and games, but I can't justify buy something that stops working after three months again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bad display
customer_reviews.text: The display is very very low. I cannot make out what's going on on the display when I placed the display directly to the light, opposite to the light, placed to the either side of the light. The picture placed for the item shows the display as bright enough but that's not correct, hence returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Arun

customer_reviews.title: The worse product I have ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: The sound stops working after 3 months. I called the customer service and they could not help me. Their response was since it has been 3 months the warranty is no longer valid. Their instructions to fix the problem is bogus. It's a waste of money. You are better of investing on a mini Ipad with far more free apps for kids education than this piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: AshZoeWill

customer_reviews.title: 3 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 3 year old and he loves it! It helps with his Abc's, counting, and associating letters with sounds. My son especially loves where he can just type the letters on the screen. My only dislike is that the screen is dark and fairly small. I have a hard time seeing what's on the screen, even with trying to tilt it to the ideal angle.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Leapfrog is not a good brand.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard stopped working after 3 months. Previous one I had bought elsewhere broke after 4 1/2 months. Kid isn't even throwing it, just constantly pushing buttons. I just bought the leapfrog two in one Leapad touch from Target and that keyboard didn't work out of the box! The products are cheap and I would not recommend leapfrog products in the future. It's such a shame my kid loves them, but I can't keep buying products that won't last.
customer_reviews.author: EBM

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, with buying hundreds of baby toys now, I usually rate based on overall value. Considering things like price, quality, educational value, how much my daughter will use it, features to keep it interesting, etc... This is an excellent purchase! My daughter is almost 1.5 and very into pointing to things to learn what they are. This toy was so cheap, very educational, great quality overall. There are features she can grow into and features she can enjoy now. I would highly recommend this toy! Probably one of the best purchases I have made in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: AZShopper

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time's a charm?
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved her leapfrog 2 in 1 laptop when the screen suddenly stopped working after a month or so. I was hesitant to purchase another leapfrog laptop, but it’s been 8 months and so far, so good! It’s a great learning product that keeps my daughter engaged and entertained. She especially loves the music feature and the animal sounds that accompany the animal that represent the letter of the alphabet. So in the end, I’d recommend it but with some reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie coughlin

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our 17 month old who has been overly fascinated with my wife and my laptops. I thought having an interactive screen would give him his own "laptop" geared towards his level would be a good thing. It has been great. He sat down with it for a good 30 minutes when it first got handed to him. He picked up the general idea of how to use it and make it do things for him pretty quick. Its a great toy, its got great learning potential and Im very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price but wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Just OK. Keeps my 2 year old granddaughter entertained for about 10 minutes, which is actually pretty good for her. The thing that we don't like about it is the screen isn't back lit so its hard to see whats on the screen. For the price its pretty good, but there's better things out there.
customer_reviews.author: Zavanna

customer_reviews.title: Great but short lived
customer_reviews.text: We have now gone through two of these. They are great, but die after a few months. The sounds completely disappears.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Mason

customer_reviews.title: Alphabetical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is fun for my daughter, however, I didn't realize the keyboard was in alphabetical order. Would prefer a realistic keyboard and will be paying more attention in future orders. Other than that, it's great and engaging
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift for a young child
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my youngest nephew this past Christmas. To be honest, I'm not entirely sure his age, I believe he was two at the time of receiving the gift. At first, I think just the sounds it made it were most exciting, but it seems like over the time since he's become more interested in the actual response to the random bottom pushes--in terms of finding order/meaning to the responses. SO, that suggests the toy does have educational potential and it's certainly durable. Also, the price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: ezmeray

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a young child to imitate working on a computer. LeapFrog is a reliable company and I've always liked their products for kids. This has a large display screen, plays music, does the alphabet, numbers and words. I was able to program it to spell my granddaughter's name. My only complaint is that the keyboard is in alphabetic order instead of imitating a computer's keyboard. It would be nice to get them familiar with typing, right from the beginning. Despite that, it's a favorite toy and played with whenever the grandkids are here.
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: No where near as good as the origonal. We bought this thinking it was an updated version of the one we bought for our oldest a few years ago (this one being for our youngest). The origonal leaptop was completely customizable with child's name, emails, and songs. This version doesn't even say child's name even though it claims to be personalized. It has you key in child's name and the only personalized thing it does is tell you that your name starts with the letter you pushed. We ended up returning this item for something else.
customer_reviews.author: T8rsWife

customer_reviews.title: Scratched screen on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a deep scratch across the screen. It's for a gift and I dont have time to return and order another one. Will update on how it works after Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: TDR

customer_reviews.title: Such a cute gift idea
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old and 4 yr old both have one and they love them. It really helped both of them learn their letters.. plus they got to sit next to me on my laptop and they were on their "laptops".. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PreciousCargo4

customer_reviews.title: Seemed great for about a week
customer_reviews.text: Seemed great for about a week, and then the keyboard slowly begin to die. At first just a couple letters in the top row did not work, then over the course of the next two weeks, section by section, the remaining keys no longer functioned. Now only 4 keys in on the bottom row are still functional. I opened it up to see if there was anything to fix. There are some plastic savings that had gotten on the contacts of the keyboard membrane, but cleaning those out did not help. It seems the defect is somewhere in the membrane tracings, which is a bummer and not something that can be repaired.
customer_reviews.author: apamazon

customer_reviews.title: Not a football
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchase of this little computer. My boy love it. I had to buy a second computer because my oldest decided to huck it across the room like a football smashing it into the desk. The screen busted just like a normal laptop. This give some concerns over durability over tis childs toy but also really isn't all that unexpected result. Since receiving this new one my 2 year old can nearly count to ten and likes to sing along with the puppy and gets a great deal of enjoyment out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Really loud, but son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this thing. I hid it, and he remembered it and asked for it. He is 4. Unfortunately it is pretty annoying. His favorite thing to do is to crank the volume to the highest level and play it in his baby brother's face while yelling "I LIKE THIS SONG DO YOU LIKE IT!?" This usually happens right after I have gotten the baby to sleep. If your tolerance for annoying noise is high, and you only have one child, this toy is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: Idk if my 2 year old doesn't like it because he already knows his ABC's, colors, numbers, shapes, animals...all the basics or, if it's because he still hasn't developed a longer attention span. I gotta feeling this will be one of those toys he will never get into but, im saving it for his younger brother just in case or, i might try to whip it out again for him a little bit after his third bday. Oh yea my only complaint is the x is for ox thing too. Parents know what i mean if they have this toy..
customer_reviews.author: whitney

customer_reviews.title: Over a year and still running strong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item somewhere in June 2018 for my 4-year kid and to my surprise, it's still running strong. All keys are working as expected. Usually, my son toys won't last more than 5-6 months but I would say this is made up of great material.
customer_reviews.author: Sumit Bhatnagar

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk and no response from customer service
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this product! From the first use, the contrast on the screen was horrible. Very little difference between the image and non-image areas, making it very difficult to see. After four weeks the keyboard stopped working making this impossible to use. I contacted LeapFrog and they will not respond. Unfortunately we were past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 3-year-old nephew, who has been playing with it constantly, according to his parents. Since the parents work from home, my nephew also busts out his "laptop" and tells them he can't talk now, because he has to work. Mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Admiral Redbush

customer_reviews.title: We both love this toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2.5 year old son. He was so excited! He just loves it! He carries it around and tells everyone that it's "my laptop". He quickly started mimicking the letters and their sounds. He loves to dance to the music. And yes you can personalize it! He loves that when It's on the alphabet mode that his name appears on the screen. He pushes the K and it says "that's the first letter of your name, let's spell it" and it proceeds to spell hims name!! We both love this toy! Very pleased with it, but I just love LeapFrog products in general. Would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: HustlinHawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my two-year-old
customer_reviews.text: My two-year-old son is OBSESSED with this product and carries it with him everywhere. I don't think he understands any of the commands yet, but he loves pressing the buttons to get a response and watching the animation on the screen. He's learning the alphabet, so I think this is really helping him. I purchased this on a whim, but I'm really glad I did! He has been playing with it nonstop for the past six months.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Koivu

customer_reviews.title: it could be a great learning toy
customer_reviews.text: My grandson likes this, however doesn't yet use it correctly to actually learn (just loves to push the buttons). As with all these toys when a button is pushed it is interrupted with another push, which I wish someone would solve someday. The screen is not very bright and is difficult to see. However if your little one is past just wanting to push buttons, it could be a great learning toy. It provides many options to be educational.
customer_reviews.author: Petalblush

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating because my twin grandchildren (15 months old) love and fight over this item because of the music ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this item twice in the last year. Both times they stopped working within a few months. Very frustrating because my twin grandchildren (15 months old) love and fight over this item because of the music it plays. How many to I have to purchase to get one that will last 6 months??
customer_reviews.author: barb scoles

customer_reviews.title: High quality!  My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 22 month old son absolutely loves this laptop. He usually plays with things for a max time of 5 minutes, but this little laptop is always with him, and he will sit with it and dance along with this songs for 20 plus minutes per session. I am impressed with it also, it teaches the alphabet, animals, and songs. It requires interaction, which he picked up on pretty quickly. Its a great learning tool for little ones. For the price, this is the highest quality item on the market... The sounds are clear, there are lots of features and options. This is a great buy! I am very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin R.

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning tool
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old nephew loves his “computer”. His mom works from home and he always wants to copy her so we got him a computer of his own. He practices saying his letters as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shop

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a couple months...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 21 month old for Christmas. He loved it and was getting good at guessing the animals (though the screen seems very outdated, I'd think Leap Frog has the technology for an upgrade!). Anyway, it stopped working after 2 months. The "T" is the only button that works now, and "turtle" gets old fast. I wouldn't recommend buying this product. Spend the extra $ for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gottaluvwsp

customer_reviews.title: It actually teaches the ABC's
customer_reviews.text: My two daughters (one and two year old) both love this toy. They constantly take it all over the room and push buttons, laugh and sing along to the song section. My two year old has learned the ABC's better since playing with it also so that's something i appreciate. Overall I feel like my daughter was better off with the Leaptop then without it. Update: less than a year later its broken on both settings on a loop....leap frog isn't what it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: M Carolin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wish I noticed that didn’t have any numbers, the screen it’s pretty small and in black and white. Doesn’t catch my toddler attention at all... just another toy that he doesn’t find interested.
customer_reviews.author: erika Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Not So Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great learning toy and fun for my two year old grandson. He loved pushing the buttons, listening to the music and hearing the alphabet etc. But the screen is a waste of space! So dark you cannot distinguish what animal or letter is being displayed. I considered returning it but he likes opening and closing it and carrying it around so I let him keep it. Money wasted...surely the manufacturer knows what a disappointing present this made...and yet, it's sold for toddlers as an educational item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, stop working within weeks of purchasing it
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loved this to.. It worked fine for about three weeks and then the audio was so low you could not hear it anymore. Thinking it was the battteries, I changed them but it did not make a difference. I am sorely disappointed, but since she keeps trying to playing with him and is getting so upset when it does not respond, I am planning to buy the pink version hoping I will have better luck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane

customer_reviews.title: Worked with no problems
customer_reviews.text: kids loved it and never had a single problem with this Leaptop. We've had it for 3 years and still works our 3 year old uses it now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson who is 2. He really enjoys having his own "computer" even though he can't yet understand all the functions on it. It has given my daughter a break from him wanting to play on her real computer, and it occupies the baby for quite some time. He is very interested in all the sounds and music and really loves the animal noises. I'm sure he will begin learning the letters and their sounds as he gets older. I am pleased with the durability of the toy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Great and Strudy
customer_reviews.text: My Two little ones love it. One is 1 and half and the other is 4. They both enjoy it. Keeps them occupied while my bigger ones do there homework on their Laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: Fun, educational and not super annoying
customer_reviews.text: I've actually purchased this toy twice now! It engages the kids while being somewhat educational and it isn't completely annoying if you are sitting there having to listen to it. There are a variety of little activities to keep the little ones engaged and distract them from wanting to play on my computer, at least for a bit. They can learn animals, letters, and a few other simple things. My 2 and 5 yr old were equally entertained by it.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: quality got worse
customer_reviews.text: We had the same one few year’s ago for my daughter, so we decided to get this again for my son. However the quality was not the same as before this time. Buttons feel lower quality and some buttons needed to be pressed harder to work. I wish it has a lower case letters too!
customer_reviews.author: Zaya

customer_reviews.title: Liked it enough to repurchase
customer_reviews.text: Technically,being under 2, my son is too young for this. But,I wanted to start introducing him to letters, numbers,in a different form. We had one for our daughter,and she loved it,so we bought it again. I would recommend it to other parents. It's sturdy,and engaging while being educational.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Arnold

customer_reviews.title: I love this toy
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy. My son had leaned all the letters from it before he turned 2 and now he and his little brother fight over it constantly. Little bro has the VTech one that is similar but this is the one they both want to play with because it's much easier to use. I have bought a few others for friends' kids because it's a tried and tested toy and it's educational. You can program this to spell your child's name as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smallback

customer_reviews.title: Great toy from leapfrog!  My autistic son loves it!  Wish it lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: My autistic son LOVES this little laptop. It's very cute, informative and has lots of different ways to play. This was his go to before we got him his own ipad and he still plays with it from time to time. The only problem is it stopped working after several months of heavy play and we have to get a new one. That one eventually died as well. Great toy, might not be one that lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: Kate MahoneyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Seemed Behind the Times But My Grandson Loves Having a Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is all good. My only concern is that the computer screen seems so behind the times. It has a black and gray screen and the graphics are very 'flat'. It just seems that Leapfrog would be way past this by now, with color, bright screen, and 3D graphics.
customer_reviews.author: BAS

customer_reviews.title: We got it because he was so interested in our keyboards and he loved it. He loved the music (which drove me ...
customer_reviews.text: This toy single handedly taught my son with autism his upper case letters when he was 16 months old. We got it because he was so interested in our keyboards and he loved it. He loved the music (which drove me a little batty but he was happy). My only complaints are that the first one we bought stopped working after 9 months or so, and it doesn't do lower case letters.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 3 weeks..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 20 months old girl. She didn't really understand the concept but she loved it! She especially loved the music mode. However it stop working after 3 weeks. I know it's because it kept falling but I wished it hold on to at least 6 months...
customer_reviews.author: Konbu

customer_reviews.title: My little Nephew loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: My Nephew who is 20 months loves this toy, I needed an electronic device that would be fun for him so he would not be trying to use my smart phone since that is not good for a baby. Plenty of activities to entertain a toddler aged child in combination with others this is great for their development.
customer_reviews.author: E. Monsanto

customer_reviews.title: As with all of Leapfrog products the packaging is painful so unwrap and prep to wrap because it takes ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old niece loves this! The packaging is a pain, but she's all over this! She loves when the C-Cat shows up and is all about the music. She drags this around, so it is durable. As with all of Leapfrog products the packaging is painful so unwrap and prep to wrap because it takes FOREVER to get out of the factory packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Hzlblu4ever

customer_reviews.title: Poor lighting and display
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a very good learning device for small children, you care barely see anything on the display screen whether you're in the light or dark. You literally have be under a very bright light in order to clearly see the display. I will have to return item.
customer_reviews.author: plush furr

customer_reviews.title: My toddlers LOVE this laptop
customer_reviews.text: This educational laptop keeps my kids off of my REAL laptop. They love it. It's small enough to travel with (both by car and flying). Easy to pack in a baby bag or carry on. It has a volume control but wish it was a little quieter. My 2 year old and 3.5 year old love it and it has helped me to teach them letters, sounds, and basic vocab. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M.

customer_reviews.title: Great price, lots of features
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old daughter asked for a computer from Santa, and this is what she got. She loves to play with it, tells me that she's doing her work on it. It has a cool feature where you can enter your child's name, and it will help them learn to spell it. There's a lot of neat features that she'll get to grow into, I think this would be a great product for anywhere from 2-5 years old. And of course, the price is a great selling point!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Barcelona

customer_reviews.title: Smarter than a 15 month old?
customer_reviews.text: I have known several people over the years that have purchased these products for their kids. This time, my great-nephew got one. He has been playing with it and I hope it shows when it comes time for school. I'm giving it 4 stars only because he is showing slightly more interest in his car.
customer_reviews.author: sc1282

customer_reviews.title: Really great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: My kid played with it a lot at first. he also occupies himself with it if he wakes up early and has it in his crib. Helped teach him numbers and letters.
customer_reviews.author: guyinsandiego

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for our little achievers.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this yesterday for my autistic nephew and he Loves it. He woke up thinking about it and we had to put it in the closet before school this morning because he is so intrigued... He spends hours on it and it is already improving his speech. Its only been a day! Definitely worth the 20 bucks! Best investment for our LO
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning letters
customer_reviews.text: Read through the reviews before purchasing and was concerned about the screen being too dark but that's not an issue for us. Our child (age 2) focuses much more on the sounds it makes - the computer saying the letter, the sound it makes, and using it to name an animal - than on what she can or can't see on the screen. She also loves that she has a computer like mom and dad and likes to dance around to the music it plays.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiF

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my 6 months old baby boy who’s already obsessed with my laptop and he’s been busy with it since I got it for him.
customer_reviews.author: Elodie Thervil

customer_reviews.title: He loved it until it stoped working
customer_reviews.text: Stoped working after a few months of use. This was grandchild gift used when our 2year old uses when he visits. He loved it until it stoped working . Paw pad does not work and most keys don't either.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought fpr my 2 year old who absolutely loves it. He usually has to fight his 4 year old sister for it. They will spend hours playing with this while I get the yard done. He has learnt a lot by using this thing including all his letters and many new animals.
customer_reviews.author: N Hickman

customer_reviews.title: In this day and age I feel like there needs to be a system for our children ...
customer_reviews.text: All of these toys are interactive but they're not really individually customizable for children. In this day and age I feel like there needs to be a system for our children that we can customize specifically for them.. I initially thought that was what Spot and Violet were and was very surprised to find out they did no more than say my son's name (badly and awkwardly at that) and sing songs.. This thing doesn't do much more than you'd expect.. I don't recommend it unless you want your child to drone on.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce R.

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop, great sound and easy to carry all ...
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop, great sound and easy to carry all over. Only thing that's a downside is the dark screen. Wish it would light up. Still a good, educational toy for at home or car :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can’t believe we got such a wonderful electronic toy for such a low price
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe we got such a wonderful electronic toy for such a low price! Our 2 year old plays with this all the time. He already knew his ABC’s before he turned 2 and I think this laptop had a lot to do with this. We’ve had it for months now and it still works great. We’ve had to replace the batteries only once. It’s very simple and fun- not flashy or colorful which I like for my son being so young.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler toy to take on a plane or long road trip
customer_reviews.text: Fun, educational toy that my almost three year old son was really excited about. He calls it his "own computer." Makes a good toy to take on long trips because it is small and can entertain a toddler for a decent amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Tony K. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop toy for my youngest daughter who loved playing with it. It had fun games and sounds, and she enjoyed using it for long periods of time. Sadly, after a few months half the keyboard stopped working. I've talked to other parents who also own this toy and they reported the same defect. I've reached out to customer service at Leapfrog to see if they will do anything, but they only have a 3 month warranty on toys like these, so I am not hopeful. Nevertheless, seems like they have a problem with this toy's keyboard durability.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love how simple and sturdy this is. My oldest had a beloved vtech computer that was fun but complicated. I was hoping this would be better and it was. My kids haven't put it down and I found my 6 year old playing with when the 3 year old went to the bathroom. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Hootnroo

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Screen is too dark and does not light up so my granddaughter got bored because she can't see what is going on on the screen and does not play with it.
customer_reviews.author: sgreenn

customer_reviews.title: Battery Coils Rust
customer_reviews.text: I got my son this toy for his birthday to help him learn his ABC's and be able to play like mommy on a computer. But about a week ago the computer stopped working. Today when I opened the battery case to replace them, come to find out the coils that you connect the flat end of the battery to had rusted. Which is strange because how could they have rusted. he just got the toy back in April and the battery case has never been open until today. With the rust on the coils that computer does not work anymore. Which is upsetting because now my son no longer has his favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Onnie

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Such a simple design, much like the toy computers I had as a child. I love that the songs are familiar because we own other leap products. My almost 2 year old son is obsessed with the alphabet, and his daddy is an IT specialist, so he is around a lot of technology he cannot touch. Even the simple process of opening, and closing the device makes him so happy. He has his own special lap top :) This was definitely the big hit Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Paul and Tina Whiteside

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loses interest in this quickly
customer_reviews.text: I'm really surprised to see so many positive reviews. I got this for my 2.5 year old daughter for Christmas and she has shown almost no interest in it at all. I think she knows that it's more of a "toy" than a real "laptop". The images are hard to see on the screen. This was actually a total waste for us. Maybe better for younger ages like 12-18 months?
customer_reviews.author: allen

customer_reviews.title: It's a good quality product and my 20 -month old daughter likes ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good quality product and my 20 -month old daughter likes it. It wish there are more songs with it. The major issue I have is that the screen is not clear. It could have been better if the figures that pop on the screen are colored because my daughter has a rather difficult time adjusting the screen so she can see better. You can't see the screen in the dark. If it's brighter, she can play with it even in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginning Learning Tool for Learning Letters, Sounds and Words. Kids Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our granddaughter, age 5 at the time, who enjoyed using it and it was a good learning tool for her at her age to help learn the letters of the alphabet and sounds and beginning reading words along with music and games. It appearance, including flip-top lid, resembles a small laptop computer and kids can feel special now that they have their own laptop just like Mom and Dad.
customer_reviews.author: JMark

customer_reviews.title: Really great product. I actually love all of the LeapFrog ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her Leaptop, and has learned so much from it. She's used it since at least 6 months old, and is now two. It has not gotten old one bit. Matter of fact she lost her old one in a recent flood we experienced in our state. It was the 1st of her toys I reordered and she was so excited to have it back. Really great product. I actually love all of the LeapFrog stuff, and prefer it over Vtec products.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs_G_lover

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: We gave this as a gift and when we had a child we were given one as a gift. They are awesome. Toddlers treat them like their own personal laptop. Great games with variety including music, counting, and letters.
customer_reviews.author: Mace

customer_reviews.title: it looked like fun for my grandson
customer_reviews.text: I got the item and was excited to let my grandson use this item....I bombed...The only button that worked was the L button...If it had worked, it looked like fun for my grandson...He was very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: melodie reviews

customer_reviews.title: She loves this, the songs are very exciting
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my daughter she just turned 2 she has been using it over 5 months and she is still a fan of it, the email mode and the song mode are her favorite she loves the animal sounds and is able to identify every letter thanks to this item
customer_reviews.author: H. Peterson O.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Our first Leaptop arrived defective and our second one broke after 3 months. My 2.5 year old loved this and was upset when it broke. Amazon would not accept the return and LeapFrog only offered a 90 day warranty. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very dark screen
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE save your money. The screen is SO dark I dont even think my son knows what to look at . So dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ginabeanuhh

customer_reviews.title: It's OK but I was looking for a little bit more in the video department
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little learning tool. My one year old granddaughter plays with it but I wish it would do little more interaction with the video that she could do.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah MyersMyers

customer_reviews.title: 2yo loves it
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for a 2yo, and it's holding up well. Didn't take long to figure out either. Adults will appreciate the variety in music and volume control, plus the auto-off. Update 18 months later: Still being played with! Now the animals and music tend to be used less than the "email" functions. The lack of backspace (not that the child knows what that is) seems to provoke occasional breakdowns when a typo happens, but it's definitely worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Caril

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS! The idea of introducing a laptop or ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS! The idea of introducing a laptop or tablet but not having the access and same kind of screen time is great. So much learning. My 19 month old so absolutely loves this bit also doesn’t turn into a zombie like I feel like tends to happen with other “screens.”
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I have two 2 year old grandsons and they both have this toy. They love that they have their very own computer and it keeps them from playing with mine. It’s very educational too.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Yerton

customer_reviews.title: X is for Ox??
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, but not what I hoped for. I guess you get what you pay for. My only real isssue is they didn't even try to google an animal that begins with X. I'd rather my kid learns an obscure bird or fish that starts with X than mis-learn that Ox begins with X. Stupid.
customer_reviews.author: RAK

customer_reviews.title: Great gift that will last!
customer_reviews.text: It has taken me a long time to write a review but I just noticed I never left one. My son has had this for over 4 years not and this is one tough toy. He still plays with it, he is developmentally delayed so it is still appropriate for him. He sill loved that it loves him name and that the emails are personalized. This was a great purchased. I would totally buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Joey's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!!
customer_reviews.text: My son received this toy at 12 months old and he loves it! He figured out how to play the music and enjoys all the different features and sounds. At 16 months old, As he grows I see him playing with it differently yet still enjoying every minute. We take it everywhere with us (road trips, vacations, grandma's house). It's one of his favorite toys.
customer_reviews.author: whereisheather

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this LeapFrog Leaptop for my grandson who has the LeapFrog dog, Scout, for a Birthday present. I haven't given it to him yet because his 1st birthday isn't for a couple months, yet. My 1 1/2 year old granddaughter got the LeapFrog Leaptop Violet and completely loves it. My grandson loves his dog, Scout, so I'm sure he'll like the Leaptop, too. What I like is the fact that it is easy to use and holds up well under toddler abuse. The activities also hold the young people's attention for much longer than toys usually do.
customer_reviews.author: Chany

customer_reviews.title: My toddler wasnt in to it but great toy
customer_reviews.text: I like it, my toddler plays with it every once in awhile. I got it for him for when I'm doing school work on my lap top he can have his own. He still wanted my lap top instead.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a good toy very age appropriate. Keeps toddler busy and is educational
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5. Yo son got this for Christmas and has played with it so much! He thinks he is so cool that he has his own computer... lol! My favorite is listening to him sing the alphabet along with it! Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: OregonMomma

customer_reviews.title: Fun for my 3 year olds
customer_reviews.text: I've got two 3 year old twin girls who have very short attention spans, but this product seems to keep them entertained. They both like the feature that says their names when you turn it on, and it gives it that personal touch. As far as graphics go, it's pretty basic (no color, animation is really simple), but for the price it's a fun toy overall. I think it's a good toy in the today's society especially because almost everything we do in today's world is on a computer, so I think it crucial that kids learn and are familiar with computer functions from an early age.
customer_reviews.author: Nipponfraser

customer_reviews.title: I think he like it. I feel the voices on all your ...
customer_reviews.text: i am rating this for my 16 month old grandson....I think he like it. I feel the voices on all your products sound the same. there can be a adjustment to the voices. I do like the Leapfrog product...the quality of the product is very good. What I like about this toy is that there is no blinking lights... All and All m grandson likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Eunice P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very educational, fun and small enough for your toddler/pre-schooler to carry around comfortably. Very interavctive and a powerful learning tool. My three year old cannot have enough and his cousins two and a half and five also love it. The toy can be personalized via the leapfrog connect website and that is a great hit with them. Cons: My only complaint is that there shoud be more variety in e-mails, blogs and songs. We should be able to download more to the computer than we can now. This toy is a big hit and a great learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Renell Clarke

customer_reviews.title: no personalization
customer_reviews.text: I guess I was under the impression this was just like the previous model of Leapfrog laptops that would allow personalization. We purchased this to replace our broken laptop and my son is disappointed it doesn't say his name. He used to love the old version, but rarely plays with this one. That being said, if you know this about the product, I don't think you would be disappointed. It is fun and does entertain my 15-month old. He knows a lot of words and speaks about 25, partly attributable to the repetitive nature of these types of toys.
customer_reviews.author: leahmc

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for my toddler!
customer_reviews.text: I got this toy for my 2 year old's birthday. I luckily realized that I had to set it up first before she could play! I love that you can have it say her name, and also have the correct spelling. My daughter's name is not spelled the way it typically is, so that was a big plus! I love the little messages you can customize, and the fact that you can pick what songs that it plays. My daughter took to this toy right away! She loves it. It is our car toy. It is super easy for her to figure out (where some of the toddler laptops are not so easy). Thanks leapfrog for making another fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon greenie

customer_reviews.title: Breaks down after a few months
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Leapfrog Leaptop we got for our toddler, and like the first, it lasted for a few months (5 months for the second one) before it stopped working. It was great while it worked. If this would last a couple of years, I would give it a better rating.
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: I love the concept but the screen on this thing is ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept but the screen on this thing is awful. No way that I can get my toddler to play with this after seeing my iPhone. It looks like a Tamagotchi screen straight from 1996. Also, the sounds stopped working after 17 months, even with new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: ajsteph

customer_reviews.title: Tough toy
customer_reviews.text: My two son is rough on anything he touches. Likes to stomp and drop all toys and them some. This rugged and serves as a great learning tool i e Recommend this product for learning and longevity
customer_reviews.author: E.J.

customer_reviews.title: Kiddo loves it
customer_reviews.text: We've only had this toy for a week, but so far our little boy loves it. He was always trying to touch and hit our adult laptops. So we thought a kiddie laptop would make him happy and help keep our electronics safe. It seems to be working. He loves to open and close it and hit the buttons. The songs are not annoying (yet anyway). I'll update this review with time if it breaks, etc.
customer_reviews.author: S.D.

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining and educational for kids
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Very educational my 1.5yr old loves this so much. Good that it teaches alphabets with phonics and I am sure she will not outgrow it soon like most of her other toys. Very handy and built in handle makes it easier for the toddler to carry it around. The display of pictures along with sound is very helpful for kids to relate the name of the animal with it's image.
customer_reviews.author: Fonz

customer_reviews.title: Great computer for your little one
customer_reviews.text: My son started wanting to type on our laptop when he was about nine month old so we purchased this computer thinking it could "grow with him." We have been right so far! He LOVES that is says his name and is currently obsessed with the music setting. I think this laptop will provide months and years of entertainment as he begins to understand the direction that "Scout" (the voice of the computer - much like other LeapFrog toys) is giving. Hooks up to caregivers computer, customizable, overall great product. Thanks LeapFrog!
customer_reviews.author: L. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: My son loved this computer/leaptop and it was great for the first ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this computer/leaptop and it was great for the first 2.5 months. He used it regularly and always under adult supervision so there was no rough play or dropping the leaptop. Currently we have owned this item for 4 months and the audio no longer works, which is one of the biggest perks of this item. I am passed the allow return policy window and Leapfrog has only given me a suggestion to clean out the battery compartment and insert new batteries but this has not helped. I would have thought Leapfrog's quality would have been better but I guess I was wrong. I now have to search for another brand for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This is a different variation of the LeapFrog computer my daughter owns, and my son loves it. Highly recommend. Love that it is educational!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

product_meta.title: LeapFrog My Own Leaptop, Green
product_meta.description:
The pretend computer play with My Own Leaptop gets even better with a new larger screen! Explore 4 learning modes and even customize My Own Leaptop to spell your child's name! Send and receive pretend emails, learn letters and animal names, and sing along with 16 songs and melodies. Age 2+ years Features Leaptop's new, larger screen makes the pretend computer play even bigger, featuring 26 fun animal animations! Tap away in 4 learning modes, including ABCs, Messages, Games, and Music. In ABC mode children can hear the letter, the letter sound, and a word using that letter. In Message mode children can pretend to send and receives emails with Scout. In Games mode, play fun animal trivia and letter games to reinforce the learning. In Music mode, choose from 16 fun songs and melodies. Personalize the play by learning to spell your child's name together! Plus, a perfectly-sized handle enables on the go fun—wherever and whenever! Learning Difference Alphabet and early vocabulary learning is reinforced with every tap of a letter as children play on a laptop made just for them. Fun animations bring the learning to life, and children are able to pretend to exchange emails with Scout! Testimonial "My Own Leaptop™ introduces basic computer literacy skills to young children in an age-appropriate and entertaining way. Chidlren role-play typing on a laptop while learning letter sounds and animal names, and playing games and activities." - Clement C., LeapFrog Learning Expert

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The pretend computer play with My Own Leaptop gets even better with a new larger screen! Explore 4 learning modes and even customize My Own Leaptop to spell your child's name! Send and receive pretend emails, learn letters and animal names, and sing along with 16 songs and melodies. Age 2+ years Features Leaptop's new, larger screen makes the pretend computer play even bigger, featuring 26 fun animal animations! Tap away in 4 learning modes, including ABCs, Messages, Games, and Music. In ABC mode children can hear the letter, the letter sound, and a word using that letter. In Message mode children can pretend to send and receives emails with Scout. In Games mode, play fun animal trivia and letter games to reinforce the learning. In Music mode, choose from 16 fun songs and melodies. Personalize the play by learning to spell your child's name together! Plus, a perfectly-sized handle enables on the go fun—wherever and whenever! Learning Difference Alphabet and early vocabulary learning is reinforced with every tap of a letter as children play on a laptop made just for them. Fun animations bring the learning to life, and children are able to pretend to exchange emails with Scout! Testimonial "My Own Leaptop™ introduces basic computer literacy skills to young children in an age-appropriate and entertaining way. Chidlren role-play typing on a laptop while learning letter sounds and animal names, and playing games and activities." - Clement C., LeapFrog Learning Expert
feature_bullets: Learn about the alphabet, spell your name and more on a pretend play Leapfrog computer built for kids.
Customize My Own Leaptop to help your child spell his or her name.
Leapfrog new, larger screen makes the pretend computer play even bigger, featuring 26 fun animal animations! Tap away in 4 learning modes, including ABCs, Messages, Games, and Music.
Send and receive pretend emails, learn letters and animal names, and sing along with 16 songs and melodies.
Pretend to be like Mom and Dad with fun computer role-play, such as emailing with Scout, and a take-along handle. Ages 2-4 years
Alphabet and early vocabulary learning is reinforced with every tap of a letter as children play on a laptop made just for them.
Fun animations bring the learning to life, and children are able to pretend to exchange emails with Scout!

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
